member.name: T:FinalExam.WritingUtensil
member.summary: Represents a writing utensil, for example a pen or pencil or something else with which one can write.

member.name: F:FinalExam.WritingUtensil.color
member.summary: Color that shows when this object is used.

member.name: M:FinalExam.WritingUtensil.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the WritingUtensil class.
member.param: Color of the writing utensil (the color that shows when the utensil is used).

member.name: P:FinalExam.WritingUtensil.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the color that shows when this object is used.

member.name: T:FinalExam.Pencil
member.summary: Represents a pencil, which has a lead type property.

member.name: M:FinalExam.Pencil.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Pencil class. Throws a LeadTypeException if leadType is not a valid lead type.

member.name: M:FinalExam.Pencil.ValidLeadTypesAsString
member.summary: Returns a comma-delimited string listing all valid lead types. This method can be used by the calling code, however its primary use is for the LeadTypeException class itself.

member.name: M:FinalExam.Pencil.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this object.

member.name: P:FinalExam.Pencil.LeadType
member.summary: Sets or gets the lead type for this object. Valid lead types are: HB, 2B and 4B. Throws LeadTypeException.

member.name: T:FinalExam.LeadTypeException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when a Pencil's LeadType is set to an invalid type, which may occur in the constructor or the LeadType property. See the LeadType property for valid types.

member.name: M:FinalExam.LeadTypeException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LeadTypeException class with a default message.

member.name: T:FinalExam.BallPointPen
member.summary: Represents a ballpoint pen, which has a thickness property.

member.name: M:FinalExam.BallPointPen.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the BallPointPen class. Throws a ThicknessException if thickness is invalid. See Thickness property for valid thicknesses.
member.param: Color that is shown when this object is used.
Thickness of the point. See Thickness property for valid thicknesses.

member.name: M:FinalExam.BallPointPen.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this object.

member.name: M:FinalExam.BallPointPen.ValidThicknessesAsString
member.summary: Returns a comma-delimited string listing all valid thicknesses. This method can be used by the calling code, however its primary use is for the ThicknessException class itself.

member.name: P:FinalExam.BallPointPen.Thickness
member.summary: Sets or gets the thickness for this object. Valid thicknesses are : fine, medium and broad. Throws ThicknessException.

member.name: T:FinalExam.ThicknessException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when a BallPointPen's Thickness is set to an invalid thickness, which may occur in the constructor or the Thickness property. See the Thickness property for valid thicknesses.

member.name: M:FinalExam.ThicknessException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ThicknessException class with a default message.
